MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Recap of Episode 1. Fussen, a descendant of the Eisengrad aristocracy, summons me to her castle, and when I get to her residence―she's carrying a strange toddler in her arms.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: It's a real problem, Conductor. I'm proud to say that I'm the best in the world at collecting and appraising artifacts, but I've never learned how to handle a live human child.

Fussen. I'm not mad at you, I just want you to be honest with me.
… Where did you kidnap them from?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: You're so rude it's amazing sometimes.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I think I've been accused of the same thing before, but I would never kidnap an innocent child! Don't make fun of me!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: As a noblewoman and the Lady of this land, I can use my authority to keep cute girls around as much as I want― Though the thought did cross my mind for a moment!

You've thought about it? You have an unusual obsession with girls, like Yakutsk and Murmansk in the SSS. Sometimes, I even get complaints from other members of the squad. They say things like they're afraid they'll be kidnapped.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Complaints? What do you mean!?
All I want to do is rub their cheeks and show my affection to soft and pliable girls!

That's what all perverts say.
I want you to give up and turn yourself in, Fussen.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Do you want to die!? I've never been humiliated like this before in my life, I thought you would believe me, Conductor!
Fussen, surprisingly, droops down in a pensive manner. In response to her voice, the toddler, who had apparently dozed off, wakes up vaguely and blinks curiously.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Oh, I didn't mean to wake you. It's all right, it's all right.
All non-noble people like him are vile pigs, but this pig named Conductor is harmless.

While being subtly rude, Fussen takes the toddler in her arms with surprising gentleness and rocks it while comforting it. The toddler doesn't resist and is happy to look up at the smiling Fussen and squeal.

It seems that the child is very fond of you.
Are you taking care of a relative's child? They seem to look a lot like you, Fussen.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hmm, do we look alike? I thought she looked more like you, Conductor...
If you ask me, I think the child in Fussen's arms does look like me when I was little. I know this because I have looked at past albums many times in my search for my mother who has disappeared.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: He seems to be a boy. Of course, I didn't take it off any clothes to check, so I'm not sure. He's a little bit dirty, so you can give him a bath later.

I don't mind that. Who is this baby?
Their face is very similar to my own, but the hair and eyes are the same color as Fussen's...
It's like Fussen and I had a child.

Why are you being so quiet?
I'm joking, in case you were wondering.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: No, I mean, I knew that wasn't a possibility... but imagined the same thing. It's too similar to be another person's likeness.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I was wondering if there was some kind of accident,
and I accidentally carried your child and gave birth to it.

What kind of accident? You can't have a baby by accident.
It needs to grow from a properly fertilized egg.

Apparently, the child is about three years old,
but three years ago, I had not yet met Fussen.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Ugh. It's not something you can say by the book. You're a man who doesn't understand romance. In a world filled with illusions, there is no such thing as "impossible"―Isn't that what you say?
I don't think I've said it enough times to make it a habit.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hmm. That's what a habit is, you know. I have become so close to you that I can remember such things. We have shared the same time and exchanged words and phrases.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
When I first met you, I thought you were an unreliable and unassuming commoner.
You never know what life has in store for you, and that makes it all the more enjoyable.

When I first met you, Fussen,
I was disgusted by what a proud, foul-mouthed aristocrat you were.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hmm. I'm sure you're right, I should have been more honest with you earlier. But in this country where the aristocracy has been abolished, there are too many enemies to be wary of.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: If I don't stick it out, I'll be crushed...

Fussen murmurs wistfully as she holds the toddler in her arms like a stuffed animal. I remind myself that she is still young― a mentally immature girl because she has been shut up in the castle for so long.

I have to support her myself, I think.
We don't know who the toddler she's carrying is, and we need to do some background research...

In the meantime, I'm too uneasy to entrust the care of the child only to her
since she seems to have no ability to live by herself.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: You're thinking of something subtly profane, aren't you?
Of course not. The first thing we need to do is to clean him up and give him a meal. We'll calm him down, make him understand that we're not the enemy, and find out what happened if we can.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hmm. I'll do everything I can, for this little one.
Fussen smiles and hugs the little toddler even tighter―perhaps to reassure him.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
It's okay, it's okay. You don't have to worry about anything anymore, I'll protect you.
Conductor...let's start by giving this child an adorable name.

No, you can't just give him a name without permission.
He's not a wild animal, and the child should have a name given to by his parents.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Even so, it would be inconvenient not to give it a nickname.
He looks just like you, so how about the name "Conductor"?
Even if I think about it, people will confuse him and me.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
It's okay. You're gonna be a fine man just like your daddy, Conductor.
Good boy, Conductor. Cute little Conductor...♪

Fussen is taking care of the toddler, ignoring my opinions.
It's a strange situation, but I'll just have to make the best of it, as usual.
Continue to Episode 3.
